title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Parkview Community Hospital Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a little disorganized but was fun. We laughed a lot and I got an offered with an hour. They do make you take a dosage exam but give you a cheat sheet. It was a 2 person panel.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work at Parkview Hospital

title: Registers Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Parkview Community Hospital Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The process was fairly easy. Try to bring a portfolio with necessary documents ( resume, license, certifications, etc..) The staff was incredible nice and understanding. They were also very helpful.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you were out of ratio and needed to take on another patient

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Parkview Community Hospital Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Very Basic questions, nice staff. Panel interview, mostly behavioral questions. The HR manager was very sweet and helpful throughout the whole process. Math test after interview, simple medication math. Overall, simple and not a difficult process at all. Got back to me quickly and received an offer about a week after my interview.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you encountered a difficult patient and how you responded.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Parkview Community Hospital Medical Center (Riverside, CA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then attended the hiring fair. Applied for DOU, given a med math quiz and they dont let you use calculators so practice % with decimals. Got a call the same day to schedule 2nd interview, 2nd interview was a group with 6 other people, had to work together to prioritize patient scenarios. Got a call two days later with a job offer
Interview Questions:
What makes you unique?
Why this hospital?
How to do feel about caring for COVID 19 patients?
Is it okay to break the set rules?
What is your most memorable moment throughout clinical?
What do you fear about COVID 19?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Parkview Community Hospital Medical Center (Riverside, CA) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Group interview two rounds and you have to interview in front of a panel which consists of the supervisor for ever department. They will ask you your top three departments that you would want to work at.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in the ED

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Parkview Community Hospital Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Group interview with 5 applicants and panel of managers from each department and CNO. Asked questions based on personality and experience and then did a group activity given different patient scenarios and how you would handle them
Interview Questions: What department do you want to work in and why did you choose that department

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Parkview Community Hospital Medical Center (Riverside, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied at Job Fair held at the hospital where they had tables set up for each specialty (Med/Surg, ER, ICU, etc).   Was called in next week for a panel interview, which consisted of 5 department heads.   Our group of new grads consisted of 5 people.  First, our group went inside the conference room where each department head asked us a question and then everybody in the group had to answer it.  It felt a bit awkward to hear same question answered 5 times.  After those questions were done, we were presented with a scenario where we had to work as a group to prioritize 5 patients and then discuss possible treatments for those patients.  We were given only 3 minutes to figure out those scenarios so I guess the point of this exercise was to test our teamwork to see how everybody was working together under pressure.  Afterwards, we were  given a 2-page medication worksheet to complete.  No calculator was allowed so brush up on your long division skills beforehand.  The whole interview took us about 2 hours.  We were told the results of the panel interview with offer letters the following week.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Parkview Community Hospital Medical Center (Riverside, CA) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview, they didn’t tell us until we got there. It was about two hours long. Each person had to answer the question. There was a math test at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where your patient rapidly declined. What did you do, what was the outcome?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Parkview Community Hospital Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with 5 heads of departments. Questions were asked for each member to answer individually. After that the group was asked to complete a group activity in which they had to prioritize 5 patients and discuss possible treatments the doctor would call for and possible nursing interventions that would be needed for each patient.  After the interview the interviewees were given a medication worksheet to complete.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself and why you became a nurse.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Parkview Community Hospital Medical Center (Riverside, CA) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: it was internal hire. I switched department by applying for an open position. It was a panel interview and there was also a skills test with med math. A lot of the questions were group answers so I had to collaborate with the other nurse interviewing with me.
Interview Questions: How did you handle negative feedback about your performance

title: RN Full Time Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Parkview Community Hospital Medical Center in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: My interview was less than an hour. Nice manager, easy going and helped relieve my stress by her kindness. Too bad she is gone now though. Be confident, not too much.
Interview Questions: of course tell me about yourself

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Parkview Community Hospital Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Interview lasted few minutes and asked what kind of problems do I usually encounter and how to complete them. Why do I want to work for them. What goals do I have in the next five years.
